page.title: 03Religion and the church
page.content: The church is Church of England but as it is the only church in the village it welcomes other denominations. It has a choir of 12 and an organist. Services are held every Sunday and there is also a Sunday school unless there was a family service. A young peoples' group is affiliated to the church and meets on Sunday evenings. The vicar has been there six years and has no assistants. Although he lives in Shepreth he conducts services in Barrington village and leads religious education at Barrington school. The church itself was built in 1635, though it may have had earlier origins.
